metadata.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Setres.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE. Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution. It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\setres.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.name), lower('\\choice')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\choice.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\windows\\syswow64\\choice.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE. Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution. It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.
